channel.title: Mysql
channel.description: Well some one on moparscape reminded me that i could never get java/mysql to work, I was gunna use it to make a basic counter for my site and was gunna make a database that, when some one uses my port scanner, it saves all the ports in use to the database, sorta like a survey. Well yea, beyond that, i really want to know how to do it, i had tried a few scripts out but they always failed at loading the driver. So, can any one give me a basic working mysql/java code?

item.title: Mysql
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

eh yea i should of but at the time i was banned from these forums and having a hard time contacting a mod…(requested ban, if i have access to something i like i will not get anything else done that i should be working on lol…)

But anyways the error was simple, this line

Class.forName("com.mysql.jdbc.Driver");

couldn’d find the jdbc pacage or w/e[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 09, 2008, 04:12:51 PM[/size][hr]Oh yea, I just remembered one of the original problems, is there a way to encrypt the password for my mysql that is in the java, I think I originally had it set up so that all programs that accessed mysql were server side, like i ran a server on my computer that they checked with, it had the mysql password and all, but that was kinda rough to set up, so is there a way to really encrypt the password in the file?

Read full topic
